courseDescription: This is a comparative study of the main political, economic and social developments in the major countries of South Asia.  Themes will include democratization, problems of economic development, the role of caste and religion, the causes of intrastate conflict and interstate conflict and the influence of global forces on the region.
Technical and Digital Skills: Social development analysis in South Asia
Intrastate conflict analysis in South Asia
Interstate conflict analysis in South Asia
Global forces impact analysis in South Asia
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Presenting research findings on South Asia
Collaborating with peers on South Asian studies projects
Discussing democratization in South Asia
Communicating economic development challenges in South Asia
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of political developments in South Asia
Analyzing the role of caste and religion in South Asian societies
Identifying causes of conflict in South Asia
Problem-solving for economic development issues in South Asia
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading group discussions on South Asian issues
Organizing research projects on South Asia
Managing time effectively for studying South Asian topics

courseDescription: The history of China covering late Imperial China, the impact of Western imperialism, the Republican Period, and the establishment of the People's Republic.
Technical and Digital Skills: Analyzing the impact of Western imperialism on China
Research skills for historical data analysis
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Presenting historical findings
Collaborating with peers on historical research projects
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of historical information
Analyzing historical events and their implications
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing research materials for historical analysis

courseDescription: The history of Japan since 1800.  The decline of the Tokugawa Shogunate, modern national building in the Meiji period, domestic conflicts and war in the twentieth century, and the roots of Japan's economic prominence today.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Presenting historical findings
Collaborating with peers on historical research projects
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing historical events for cause and effect relationships
Identifying patterns in historical data
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading group discussions on historical topics

courseDescription: This course introduces students to several key religious traditions originating in Asia, such as: Hindu traditions in India; Confucianism, Daoism, and popular religion in China, Buddhism and Shinto in Japan; and Buddhist traditions of China, Tibet, and Mongolia. Students will read and analyze primary sources in English translation. By examining artifacts from literature, art, and poetry, students will also learn about cultural history. Throughout the course, we will be employing hermeneutical methods in the field of religions studies, such as methods of comparisons.
Technical and Digital Skills: Analyzing primary sources in English translation
Using hermeneutical methods in religious studies
Comparative analysis of different religious traditions in Asia
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of cultural history
Collaborative discussion of religious artifacts
Presentation of analysis of literature, art, and poetry
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of primary sources
Comparative analysis of religious traditions
Interpreting complex religious texts
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing research on different Asian religions
Managing group projects related to religious studies

courseDescription: An introduction to the architecture, sculpture, calligraphy, pottery, ink, painting, miniature painting, and gardens of India, China, and Japan.  Emphasis will be placed on the connections among the cultures: Buddhism and pilgrimage, the importance of the scholar painters, the role of trade routes and the emergence of native writing.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding architectural styles in India, China, and Japan
Knowledge of sculpture techniques in Asian art
Pottery making skills specific to Asian cultures
Garden design principles in Asian aesthetics
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Discussing cultural connections between India, China, and Japan
Presenting on the influence of Buddhism on art in Asia
Engaging in scholarly discussions on native writing emergence in Asian art
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating the impact of trade routes on Asian art development
Analyzing the role of scholar painters in Asian art history
Comparing and contrasting architectural elements in Asia
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading discussions on the importance of pilgrimage in Asian art
Organizing group projects on specific aspects of Asian art
Coordinating presentations on different cultural aspects of Asian art

courseDescription: As a required course for the Asian Studies major, the course helps students synthesize the knowledge they have learned from the undergraduate courses, write a capstone research paper and present the paper in class.  This is a writing intensive course.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication
Public speaking
Collaboration
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical thinking
Research analysis
Synthesizing information

courseDescription: This course is designed for small groups of qualified students to conduct advanced study of selected topics on Asian Studies, topics which may not be taught in regularly scheduled classes.  The description of the course for each offering will appear in the course schedule booklet that is distributed to each advisor.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborative research and discussion on Asian Studies topics
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of Asian Studies materials, analyzing diverse perspectives on Asian cultures
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Group coordination for advanced study, project management for research on selected Asian Studies topics
